body_html: No, it still fails if I remove !transposed (in fact, it fails for 1d, 2d, and 3d whereas before it used to fail for 2d and 3d because 1d dilation parameters were not passed). I think there is something wrong with the parameters passed to transposed dilated cudnn case.
body_text: No, it still fails if I remove !transposed (in fact, it fails for 1d, 2d, and 3d whereas before it used to fail for 2d and 3d because 1d dilation parameters were not passed). I think there is something wrong with the parameters passed to transposed dilated cudnn case.
body: No, it still fails if I remove !transposed (in fact, it fails for 1d, 2d, and 3d whereas before it used to fail for 2d and 3d because 1d dilation parameters were not passed). I think there is something wrong with the parameters passed to transposed dilated cudnn case.
